page.title: 03THE POPULATION OF FELMINGHAM
page.content: The total population of the Village is approximately 600, with less than 400 being on the Electorial Roll. The different age groups are evenly matched; no particular age being left out in the social life of the Village. The majority of residents live in terraced houses, but since l960, two small estates of bungalows have been built close to the Church, and also one or two houses. Local public transport is almost non-existant, and so there is great reliance on motor cars. The railway was closed many years ago, and the cutting is now used as part of the Weaver's Way Walk.
